result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Marquz Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing April 7, 2015.

*********04-07-15/ Stephanie Rothstein****
Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $7,417.71, Joint & Several with cases 14CF1613 and 14CF3934, to be paid to Aquilla R.
Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment of at least 30 hours per week or full time vocational training.

No contact with witnesses or family of the victim.
Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal substances.
No use of controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample unless previously submitted, pay surcharge.   Court waived DNA surcharge if previously paid.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession, voting and citizenship.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (59 pages) commencing 03/19/2015 received and filed. mt
As to the SENTENCING JUDGE ONLY.  Corrected to show Judge Rothstein as the sentencing Judge.
Amended JOC reflects 04-07-15 Court order for Joint & Several restitution in the amount of $7,417.71

Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in court via video conference with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared on behalf of Sara B. Lewis for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Restitution Hearing. Sidebar discussions placed on the record. Defense requests a lesser amount of restitution due to defendant's inability to pay. State requests restitution in the amount $7, 417.71 to be paid joint and several. Sworn for Defense: Michael Burks. Testimony closed. Additional arguments as to restitution from both parties. Court imposed restitution in the amount of $7, 417.71 joint and several with cases 14CF1613 and 14CF3934, to be paid to Aquilla R.

Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. State complied with victims rights legislation. State placed negotiations on the record. Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by parties, defendant, Andre R. and Aquilla R. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, concurrent with 06CF3465, with credit for 354 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

1) Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge. Court waived DNA surcharge if previously paid.  
2) No contact with witnesses or family of the victim.
3) Maintain full time employment of at least 30 hours per week or full time vocational training.
4) Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal substances.
5) No use of controlled substances.
6) Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program. The defendant is not appropriate for the Substance Abuse Program.

Court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession, Voting and Citizenship.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defense requests a Restitution Hearing. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 25.
  Restitution hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Per Court, this matter will be heard at 8:30 am on 3/19/2015 instead of 1:30pm. Parties and Sheriff's Department notified.
Received and Filed, Victim Impact Statement.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Michael Marquz Burks not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defense counsel waived defendant's appearance for this hearing. Signed stipulation as to adjournment of the sentencing received and filed. State requests adjournment of the sentencing until the co-defendant's trial is completed. Defense does not object. Court granted State's request for adjournment. State to do OTP for the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp/tk.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Parties request this matter be adjourned until after the co-defendant's jury trial is completed.  Court held colloquy with the defendant. Defendant objects to sentencing being adjourned today. Court grants adjournment and advised the parties sentencing will proceed at the next court date even if the co-defendant's trial is not completed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Michael Marquz Burks not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner on behalf of Sara Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Parties request an adjourned sentencing date until after the co-defendant's jury trial is completed. Court grants request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
order to produce.

State informs the court that parties have entered into a testimonial agreement.
To the amended charge:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Parties are requesting a status date in December after other co-actors have completed their trials.  
Case is adjourned to 12-19-2014 at 8:30am in Branch 25 for status.  Defendant is remanded.

Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 25.
Amended Information filed by the state:  Attempt Armed Robbery (Use of Force), PTAC, a class C felony pursuant to 943.32(1) (a) and (2) and 939.32 and 939.05
Defense given copy and waives reading.
Branch 25 in trial and unable to hear this matter. Branch 38 agreed to hear this matter for Branch 25. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson appeared via telephone, defendant Michael Marquz Burks not in court, in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for further proceedings. Branch 25 in trial and unable to hear this matter. Defense counsel requests projected plea date. State informs the Court Sara Lewis will be taking over this matter for the State. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for further proceedings. Attorney Wilson has recently been appointed to this matter. Defense requests adjourned scheduling date to further review the discovery materials. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for further proceedings. Defense counsel requested a projected plea date prior to case being called as defendant previously signed a proffer letter from the State. Defendant stated on the record he does not want to take the offer by the State. Due to statements made by the defendant on the record, on it's own motion Court will allow attorney Morales to withdraw as counsel of record. State notified the Court it may be in trial on the next court date and will have someone cover the court appearance if appropriate. Case scheduled farther out to allow new counsel to meet with the defendant and discuss the status of any plea. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in custody.  Miriam S. Falk on behalf of Nicole Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for further proceedings.    Parties are advised as of August 1, 2014 this matter will be reassigned to Judge Konol, Br 44 in room 506 of the safety building.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.  Further proceedings scheduled for 08-11-2014 at 08:30 am.
Received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for further proceeding.  Parties are still negotiating this matter. Defense informs the court the defendant wishes to have new counsel.  Discussion regarding defendant's request.  In chambers discussion with parties.  Court denied defendant's request at this time.  Discussion regarding pro se letter sent to the state (not opened).  Court admonished the defendant for sending mail to the District Attorney.  Case adjourned to Br 12.  Further proceedings scheduled for 07-29-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna I Morales in court, defendant Michael Marquz Burks not in court, in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for a plea, but state still needs to provide defense counsel with an offer.  Parties request an adjournment.  Co-defendant is scheduled for scheduling on 7/11/2014.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Further proceedings scheduled for 07-14-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna I Morales in court via telephone, defendant Michael Marquz Burks not in court, in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin, early.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case set for a scheduling.  State has provided defense with discovery and an offer.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-23-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the corrections of "thirty five (35) years" and "(DOB 9/3/96)" on page 1. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Michael Marquz Burks in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State's motion to amended the maximum penalty on page one of the complaint heard and granted.
